content: bunny headz materials worsted weight yarn of your choice including contrasting scraps of yarn or thread for eyes and nose size f 3 75 mm hook or size needed to produce a tight stuffable fabric in single_crochet polyester fiberfill or other stuffing material tapestry needle for joining embroidery and weaving ends abbreviations chain…chain stitch double_crochet…double_crochet half_double_crochet…half_double_crochet single_crochet…single_crochet slip_stitch…slip_stitch treble_crochet…treble_crochet yo…yarn over special stitches decrease insert hook through both loops of next single_crochet yo and pull through insert hook through both loops of next single_crochet yo and pull through yo and pull through all 3 loops on the hook 1 decrease counts as 1 single_crochet notes you may prefer to start your bunnies with a method other than the chain four/join to form ring stated alternate methods i m aware of are to start with a chain two and work the first round s single crochets into the second chain from the hook and the magic_ring method described at crochetme http //crochetme com/amigurumi-double-ring use whatever technique allows you to have the smallest or preferably non-existent hole at the beginning of the work the bunnies are worked in spirals do not join rounds each increasing or decreasing round features 6 repeats of the increase or decrease stitch pattern you may find it useful to mark the first stitch of each round this pattern can be worked with any weight yarn and an appropriate hook…bigger yarn/hook will produce a bigger piece as written the finished bunny is 1 75 inches 4 5 cm tall and has an earspan of 5 75 inches 14 6 cm pattern working from top of head chain 4 join with slip_stitch to form ring round 1 6 single_crochet in ring 6 single_crochet do not join round 2 2 single_crochet in each single_crochet around 12 single_crochet round 3 2 single_crochet in next single_crochet single_crochet in next single_crochet around 18 single_crochet round 4 2 single_crochet in next single_crochet single_crochet in next 2 single_crochet around 24 single_crochet round 5-10 single_crochet in each single_crochet around 24 single_crochet total of 6 rounds worked even round 11 decrease over next 2 single_crochet single_crochet in next 2 single_crochet around 18 single_crochet round 12 decrease over next 2 single_crochet single_crochet in next single_crochet around 12 single_crochet stuff round 13 decrease around 6 single_crochet round 14 slip_stitch as needed to close remaining gap and finish off weave in end ears chain 10 slip_stitch in 2nd chain from hook slip_stitch in next chain then single_crochet in next 2 chain half_double_crochet in next 2 chain double_crochet in next 2 chain 10 treble_crochet in last chain working up the other side of the starting chain double_crochet in next 2 chain half_double_crochet in next 2 chain single_crochet in next 2 chain slip_stitch in last 2 chain finish off leaving a long end for sewing ear to the head weave in other end or use it to help secure the ear as well finishing sew ears to head embroider face that s all there is to it bunny headz crochet pattern is
